RBE 3001

Sophomore Year College

The third robotics course in a series of four, this course teaches the fundamentals of industrial arm robotics. Forward, Inverse, and Differential Kinematics with the arm being controlled by the nucleo microprocessor. Low - level C code controls the basic PID, Motor and Sensor control while taking high level Matlab code as packets for higher level functionality.

The high level packets send information to control forward, inverse, and differential kinematics. All kinematics are patterned by the Denavit - Hartenberg convention for the necessary joints of the RBE 3001 Arm. The Denavit-Hartenberg parameters are the four parameters associated with a particular convention for attaching reference frames to the links of a spatial kinematic chain, or robot manipulator.

The final project is to use the RBE 3001 Arm and control it to sort objects by their respective color and size with forward, inverse, differential kinematics of the RBE 3001 Arm. To sort objects by color, I wrote a MATLAB script to recognize objects by computer vision with the given camera in the robot.

The Github Code can be found below :
